lenders.name: SCCBank
lenders.loan_because: SCCBank has issued a novel currency that is partially backed by environmental and social goods. We are loaning a portion of our currency reserves across the globe, via Kiva.
lenders.occupational_info:
SCCBank is a San Francisco-based financial innovation start-up, focusing on complementary currency systems. 

Ken Lynch founded SCCBank with other top tier school graduates to develop a pipeline of currency, payment, and banking innovations for a quickly changing financial and political landscape.  Start-up values include financial safety, the environment, and community.

The Carbon Coin is our first prototype currency, sold as novel art pieces.  We are investigating how to grow this project within the context of the American regulatory framework, and are exploring how future Carbon Coins and other new currency innovations (including new mediums of exchange, store of value methods, etc) should be regulated.

lenders.name: Ethical Culture Society
lenders.loan_because: We want to help others create a better world
lenders.occupational_info:
The Ethical Culture Society of Silicon Valley is a vibrant, caring community dedicated to cultivating ethical growth and action in its members and in the larger world.

Ethical Culture is a humanistic religious, philosophical, and educational movement inspired by the ideal that the supreme aim of life is working to create a more humane society.  Our focus is on how we live our lives.  Our faith is in the capacity and responsibility of human beings to act in their personal relationships and in the larger community to help create a better world.

Members come together to assist each other in developing ethical ideas and ideals; to celebrate life's joys and support each other through life's crises; to work together to improve our world and the world of our children.

It has all the shops like Amazon, Ebay, Asda, Currys, M&S, Next and more for train and plane tickets, clothes etc.

lenders.name: melliecarma aka matthias
lenders.occupation: warehouseman by day, social investor by night...
lenders.loan_because:
i want to make a difference, wanna see the money go to real people, real (smiling =;-)) faces. it's a way for me to bridge cultures, lifestyles + religion.
.
.
.

i committed myself to granting at least one microloan a month through kiva. this commitment was made on the 4th of july, 2009, upon granting my first microloan to amanullah maqsood in afghanistan.
lenders.occupational_info:
unloading containers, trucks + trailers the whole day. it pays the cost of living but otherwise it's a pretty senseless  thing to do... so i need something to balance it out which brings me here...

drowning islands like the carterets, earthquakes like in haiti and mudslides like on madeira or in the cuzco region (aguas calientes) in peru raise the question for me: what am i doing here? where's the sense in that? what can i do to make the world a better place? part of the answer lies here...

in response to "the case of the faceless lender" i changed my avatar from cool rabbid to the actual one... it's from december 2006, but then i haven't changed that much...  i also added my first name (matthias) just in case "my" borrowers might be curious... =8-) you all are great people in my book! knowing that you exist makes my life worth living...! keep on fulfilling your dreams!

lenders.name: Mr. Biss
lenders.loan_because: I'm eager to connect students to the world of microloans and individual entrepreneurs in developing countries.  Kiva can create that interface and experience...
lenders.occupational_info: By introducing students to incredible people on the other side of the planet, I hope to open opportunities for entrepreneurs and for the students themselves.

Would you help in donating to help a child today. With only 175.00 per day we can help a family in today's economy.

lenders.name: Chile BBB 09
lenders.loan_because:
We're Team Chile from the Country in A Bag Activity and we want to be a part of this BIG idea from the BBB course at Erindale!   In our 2nd week of the BBB course we formed a "Partnership" and raised $25 between the two of us.  
Mr. BI$$ converted our hard currency (Canadian cash) into a kind of "soft" currency he called "Kiva Currency".   This was a kind of electronic certificate that enabled us to actually invest in our chosen entrepreneur that decided on after much reflection.
lenders.occupational_info: We're going onto University and we created a special fund to help do microloans through Kiva, during our class.   After the course is over we can continue to monitor our particular entrepreneur's repayment success.  We can then reinvest our funds in the months and years ahead or ask for our investment back.   We can even change our team name to our individual name(s) as we become working professionals and continue to invest under the BIG Idea banner - and watch other students learn as we did!

lenders.name: Kelly
lenders.loan_because: As an Entrepreneur myself, I recognize the power of the human mind to innovate and fill a niche of need, while improving the quality of our lives.
lenders.occupational_info: Supply internet access to remote and rural areas

lenders.name: Noriko
lenders.loan_because: I believe the "person to person" microfinance is innovative and inspiring!  It enhances participation by socially aware individuals.
lenders.occupational_info:
Our NPO, Social Innovation Japan, is a non-profit organization founded in August, 2005 to promote “Social Innovation” (solving social problems by developing innovative social products & services and/or business processes to generate them) and cultivate “Social Entrepreneurs” while providing them with the open platform to expand their network.
Please visit our website http://www.socialinnovationjapan.org/c000011/

lenders.name: JPinVA
lenders.loan_because: I have a lot in common with the people who receive Kiva loans, so I understand how important Kiva's work is.
lenders.occupational_info: We operate a small coffee roastery in rural Virginia. We buy green coffee beans imported from the equatorial countries around the world. We roast them and sell them to coffee shops and to individuals via our website. Our business is very much like the sorts of businesses that Kiva provides with loans.

lenders.occupational_info: K.C.T.C. operates a non-profit business whose mission is to provide adults with developmental disabilities the opportunity to acquire skills necessary to become more productive, contributing members of their community.
